messages.messageBody:
Oops, I guess I can't post a photo on here. I have it now up on the
Shared Photos: Kim's
The hyperlink is:
*http://tinyurl.com/cln5t*

Kim

Kim Ghobrial wrote:

>Hi All,
>I have a friend on my Ancient Peddler's list (Greek and Roman Coins) and
>he would like to have some help in this photo.
>
>Kim
>
>David B. Wilber wrote:
>
>
>
>>Group:
>>
>>I'm hoping that someone on this list might be able to help me identify
>>object. It is no ancient, probably no older that WWII. It is 46mm x
>>29mm oval metal disk with Japanese writing on both sides. I not sure
>>which side is the obverse or which way is up. I've had it for 40 years
>>and have never been able to satisfy my curiosity. I even showed it to a
>>Japanese tourist once and all he could tell me that it is a military
>>script that is not taught anymore. I've attached a copy to this e-mail.
>>
>>Thanks in advance,
>>
>>Dave Wilber
>>
>>
>>
>>
>
>

>
>

messages.msgSnippet: Hi Kim, yo ucant attach photo s here, you need to host them somewhere and post a link. This Yahoo group has a hosting section if you logon to Yahoo groups and
messages.messageBody:
Hi Kim, yo ucant attach photo's' here, you need to host them somewhere
and post a link. This Yahoo group has a hosting section if you logon to
Yahoo groups and sign in.

Richard

Richard Turner
Nihontô Message Board
<http://www.nihontomessageboard.com/nmb>
- /for the discussion and sharing of all things Nihontô/

> Hi All,
> I have a friend on my Ancient Peddler's list (Greek and Roman Coins) and

>
> Kim

> > I'm hoping that someone on this list might be able to help me identify
> > object. It is no ancient, probably no older that WWII. It is 46mm x

messages.subject: Re:  Kind of Off Topic... Need some help in traslations...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All, I have a friend on my Ancient Peddler s list (Greek and Roman Coins) and he would like to have some help in this photo. Kim ... [Non-text portions of
messages.messageBody:
Hi All,
I have a friend on my Ancient Peddler's list (Greek and Roman Coins) and
he would like to have some help in this photo.

Kim

David B. Wilber wrote:

> Group:
>
> I'm hoping that someone on this list might be able to help me identify
> object. It is no ancient, probably no older that WWII. It is 46mm x
> 29mm oval metal disk with Japanese writing on both sides. I not sure
> which side is the obverse or which way is up. I've had it for 40 years
> and have never been able to satisfy my curiosity. I even showed it to a
> Japanese tourist once and all he could tell me that it is a military
> script that is not taught anymore. I've attached a copy to this e-mail.
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Dave Wilber
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
